text:
Mr. Svidrigaïlov stood by the door, listening. 

He heard voices from Sonia's room. 

He tiptoed to his own room. 

He grabbed a chair. 

Quietly, he placed it by the door. 

“I must hear more,” he thought. 

He settled in, ready to listen. 

The conversation intrigued him. 

He smiled, enjoying the moment. 

Tomorrow, he wouldn’t stand. 

He would sit and listen in comfort.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Mr. Svidrigaïlov eavesdrops on Raskolnikov and Sonia's conversation, intrigued by their exchange.
